content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> moves with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 1 i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></math> on a horizontal surface toward a stationary block of mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the figure labeled “Before Collision.” Friction between the blocks and the horizontal surface is negligible. Three possible outcomes labeled <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, are also shown. Rank the two-block system’s final center of mass speeds <math alttext="v sub P c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Pcm</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="v sub Q c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Qcm</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="v sub R c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Rcm</mtext></msub></math> after the three collision outcomes.

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub P c m equals v sub Q c m, which equals v sub R c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Pcm</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Qcm</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Rcm</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub Q c m is less than v sub R c m, which is less than v sub P c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Qcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Rcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Pcm</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub R c m is less than v sub P c m, which is less than v sub Q c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Rcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Pcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Qcm</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub P c m is less than v sub Q c m, which is less than v sub R c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Pcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Qcm</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Rcm</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub P c m equals v sub Q c m, which equals v sub R c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Pcm</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Qcm</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>Rcm</mi></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
